intro: Lupinus juninensis, commonly known as the Junín lupin, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky soils. The plant produces tall, sparsely branched stems with clusters of bright yellow to orange flowers. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small, oval-shaped leaflets. Lupinus juninensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has also been studied for its potential ecological and agricultural uses.
